trans-unit.source: StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.1 release notes – October 2014 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.1 release notes – October 2014 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes the new features, issues, and workarounds for the October 2014 StorSimple release.
trans-unit.target: Describes the new features, issues, and workarounds for the October 2014 StorSimple release.

trans-unit.source: The following release notes identify the critical open issues for StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.1 released in October 2014.
trans-unit.target: The following release notes identify the critical open issues for StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.1 released in October 2014.

trans-unit.source: They also contain a list of the StorSimple software and firmware updates included in this release.
trans-unit.target: They also contain a list of the StorSimple software and firmware updates included in this release.

trans-unit.source: This is the first release after the StorSimple 8000 Series Release version was made generally available in July 2014 and corresponds to software version 6.3.9600.17312.
trans-unit.target: This is the first release after the StorSimple 8000 Series Release version was made generally available in July 2014 and corresponds to software version 6.3.9600.17312.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you scan for and apply any available updates immediately after you install the device.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you scan for and apply any available updates immediately after you install the device.

trans-unit.source: You can also turn on automatic updates to download and install high-priority updates from Microsoft as soon as they are released.
trans-unit.target: You can also turn on automatic updates to download and install high-priority updates from Microsoft as soon as they are released.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see how to <linkText>Update your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see how to <linkText>Update your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Please review the information contained in the release notes before you deploy the updates in your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: Please review the information contained in the release notes before you deploy the updates in your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service and not Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to install the October updates.
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service and not Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to install the October updates.

trans-unit.source: The updates typically take about 3 hours to complete.
trans-unit.target: The updates typically take about 3 hours to complete.

trans-unit.source: The October release of StorSimple does not contain any updates to the StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: The October release of StorSimple does not contain any updates to the StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: You can still apply any available Windows updates, including recent security fixes, but you will not see a change in version for the virtual device.
trans-unit.target: You can still apply any available Windows updates, including recent security fixes, but you will not see a change in version for the virtual device.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the following prerequisites are met prior to updating your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the following prerequisites are met prior to updating your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that both device controllers are running before you scan for updates.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that both device controllers are running before you scan for updates.

trans-unit.source: If either controller is not running, the scan will fail.
trans-unit.target: If either controller is not running, the scan will fail.

trans-unit.source: To verify that the controllers are in a healthy state, navigate to Hardware Status under the Maintenance page.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the controllers are in a healthy state, navigate to Hardware Status under the Maintenance page.

trans-unit.source: If there are components that Need attention, contact Microsoft Support before proceeding any further.
trans-unit.target: If there are components that Need attention, contact Microsoft Support before proceeding any further.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that fixed IPs for both Controller 0 and Controller 1 are routable and can connect to the Internet as these are used for servicing the updates to the device.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that fixed IPs for both Controller 0 and Controller 1 are routable and can connect to the Internet as these are used for servicing the updates to the device.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <linkText>Test-Connection cmdlet</linkText><title></title> to ping a known address outside of the network such as outlook.com, to verify that the controller has connectivity to the outside network.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <linkText>Test-Connection cmdlet</linkText><title></title> to ping a known address outside of the network such as outlook.com, to verify that the controller has connectivity to the outside network.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <linkText>Networking requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <linkText>Networking requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If the device software version is older than 6.3.9600.17312 (October 2014 update), disable the Data 2 and Data 3 ports, if enabled, before starting the update.
trans-unit.target: If the device software version is older than 6.3.9600.17312 (October 2014 update), disable the Data 2 and Data 3 ports, if enabled, before starting the update.

trans-unit.source: If you leave the Data 2 or Data 3 ports enabled when applying the update, it may cause your device controller to go into recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: If you leave the Data 2 or Data 3 ports enabled when applying the update, it may cause your device controller to go into recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: Please note that when you disable the network interfaces, all the associated volumes will be taken offline and the I/Os will be disrupted for the duration of the update.
trans-unit.target: Please note that when you disable the network interfaces, all the associated volumes will be taken offline and the I/Os will be disrupted for the duration of the update.

trans-unit.source: This update includes the following improvements:
trans-unit.target: This update includes the following improvements:

trans-unit.source: You can now use the StorSimple Manager service UI to manage your device controllers.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the StorSimple Manager service UI to manage your device controllers.

trans-unit.source: The management actions include restart, shutdown, or turn on a controller.
trans-unit.target: The management actions include restart, shutdown, or turn on a controller.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Manage StorSimple device controllers</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Manage StorSimple device controllers</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can schedule WAN bandwidth allocation according to day-of-the-week and time-of-day combinations.
trans-unit.target: You can schedule WAN bandwidth allocation according to day-of-the-week and time-of-day combinations.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to make better use of WAN bandwidth during off-peak hours.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to make better use of WAN bandwidth during off-peak hours.

trans-unit.source: Different bandwidth templates are permitted for different volume containers.
trans-unit.target: Different bandwidth templates are permitted for different volume containers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Manage your StorSimple bandwidth templates</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Manage your StorSimple bandwidth templates</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can configure email notifications to proactively notify the administrator(s) and others of existing or possibly upcoming issues.
trans-unit.target: You can configure email notifications to proactively notify the administrator(s) and others of existing or possibly upcoming issues.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Configure alert settings</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Configure alert settings</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a summary of issues that were fixed in this update.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a summary of issues that were fixed in this update.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Applies to physical device
trans-unit.target: Applies to physical device

trans-unit.source: Applies to virtual device
trans-unit.target: Applies to virtual device

trans-unit.source: Network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Network interfaces

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, the network interfaces DATA 2 and DATA 3 were swapped in the software.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, the network interfaces DATA 2 and DATA 3 were swapped in the software.

trans-unit.source: This has been fixed in this update.
trans-unit.target: This has been fixed in this update.

trans-unit.source: Please clear the settings and disable these network interfaces before you install the update.
trans-unit.target: Please clear the settings and disable these network interfaces before you install the update.

trans-unit.source: After installing the update, you will have to reconfigure these interfaces.
trans-unit.target: After installing the update, you will have to reconfigure these interfaces.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Support package
trans-unit.target: Support package

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, if you ran the Windows PowerShell Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet to retrieve the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) logs, the operation failed with the following warning: "The operation succeeded on this controller, but failed on the peer controller due to the following error(s).
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, if you ran the Windows PowerShell Export-HcsSupportPackage cmdlet to retrieve the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) logs, the operation failed with the following warning: "The operation succeeded on this controller, but failed on the peer controller due to the following error(s).

trans-unit.source: Please check whether the peer is healthy and whether the current node can connect to the peer."
trans-unit.target: Please check whether the peer is healthy and whether the current node can connect to the peer."

trans-unit.source: This issue is now fixed.
trans-unit.target: This issue is now fixed.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Device failover
trans-unit.target: Device failover

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, there was a chance of data inconsistency if a discover backup job failed during a device failover.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, there was a chance of data inconsistency if a discover backup job failed during a device failover.

trans-unit.source: This issue is now fixed.
trans-unit.target: This issue is now fixed.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Device failover
trans-unit.target: Device failover

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, after a device failover, backups were visible but the associated volume container was not present on the target device.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, after a device failover, backups were visible but the associated volume container was not present on the target device.

trans-unit.source: This issue is now fixed.
trans-unit.target: This issue is now fixed.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Device failover
trans-unit.target: Device failover

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, there was a bug in the enumeration of cloud backups during the registry-restore operation that could potentially lead to data inconsistency if there were cloud connectivity issues.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, there was a bug in the enumeration of cloud backups during the registry-restore operation that could potentially lead to data inconsistency if there were cloud connectivity issues.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Firmware update
trans-unit.target: Firmware update

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, the device firmware update job failed and displayed an error which stated that the cmdlets were not recognizable, and that the update failed as a result.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, the device firmware update job failed and displayed an error which stated that the cmdlets were not recognizable, and that the update failed as a result.

trans-unit.source: The controller then went into recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: The controller then went into recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: This issue is now fixed.
trans-unit.target: This issue is now fixed.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: Installation

trans-unit.source: Errors caused by the device not being imaged correctly during installation have now been fixed.
trans-unit.target: Errors caused by the device not being imaged correctly during installation have now been fixed.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: You can now optionally skip the firmware check for factory reset.
trans-unit.target: You can now optionally skip the firmware check for factory reset.

trans-unit.source: This is a change from the previous release.
trans-unit.target: This is a change from the previous release.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: In the previous release, when a factory reset cmdlet was run, firmware version checks were made only for some hardware components.
trans-unit.target: In the previous release, when a factory reset cmdlet was run, firmware version checks were made only for some hardware components.

trans-unit.source: Additional firmware checks were made after the first reboot in the process, which could cause the reset to fail.
trans-unit.target: Additional firmware checks were made after the first reboot in the process, which could cause the reset to fail.

trans-unit.source: This fix ensures that all the firmware checks are made when the factory reset cmdlet is run and before the first system reboot.
trans-unit.target: This fix ensures that all the firmware checks are made when the factory reset cmdlet is run and before the first system reboot.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Storage account key rotation
trans-unit.target: Storage account key rotation

trans-unit.source: The Invoke-HcsmServiceDataEncryptionKeyChange cmdlet used to rotate the storage account keys now prompts the user to enter the service data encryption key.
trans-unit.target: The Invoke-HcsmServiceDataEncryptionKeyChange cmdlet used to rotate the storage account keys now prompts the user to enter the service data encryption key.

trans-unit.source: This is a change from the previous release in which the service data encryption key was passed as an inline parameter.
trans-unit.target: This is a change from the previous release in which the service data encryption key was passed as an inline parameter.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Failback within 24 hours
trans-unit.target: Failback within 24 hours

trans-unit.source: During disaster recovery, the cleanup on the source device did not happen cleanly, causing failback to fail.
trans-unit.target: During disaster recovery, the cleanup on the source device did not happen cleanly, causing failback to fail.

trans-unit.source: This has been fixed in this release.
trans-unit.target: This has been fixed in this release.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a summary of known issues in this release.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a summary of known issues in this release.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Comments/workaround
trans-unit.target: Comments/workaround

trans-unit.source: Applies to physical device
trans-unit.target: Applies to physical device

trans-unit.source: Applies to virtual device
trans-unit.target: Applies to virtual device

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: In some instances, when you perform a factory reset, the StorSimple device may be stuck and display this message: Reset to factory is in progress (phase 8).
trans-unit.target: In some instances, when you perform a factory reset, the StorSimple device may be stuck and display this message: Reset to factory is in progress (phase 8).

trans-unit.source: This happens if you press CTRL+C while the cmdlet is in progress.
trans-unit.target: This happens if you press CTRL+C while the cmdlet is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Do not press CTRL+C after initiating a factory reset.
trans-unit.target: Do not press CTRL+C after initiating a factory reset.

trans-unit.source: If you are already in this state, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If you are already in this state, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: Do not factory reset a StorSimple device that is updated from GA to October 2014 release.
trans-unit.target: Do not factory reset a StorSimple device that is updated from GA to October 2014 release.

trans-unit.source: This operation will only work if a patch is installed.
trans-unit.target: This operation will only work if a patch is installed.

trans-unit.source: Contact Microsoft Support to get this required patch.
trans-unit.target: Contact Microsoft Support to get this required patch.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Disk quorum
trans-unit.target: Disk quorum

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, if the majority of disks in the EBOD enclosure of an 8600device are disconnected resulting in no disk quorum, then the storage pool will be offline.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, if the majority of disks in the EBOD enclosure of an 8600device are disconnected resulting in no disk quorum, then the storage pool will be offline.

trans-unit.source: It will stay offline even if the disks are reconnected.
trans-unit.target: It will stay offline even if the disks are reconnected.

trans-unit.source: You will need to reboot the device.
trans-unit.target: You will need to reboot the device.

trans-unit.source: If the issue persists, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If the issue persists, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Cloud snapshot failures
trans-unit.target: Cloud snapshot failures

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, a cloud snapshot may fail with the error Maximum backup limit reached.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, a cloud snapshot may fail with the error Maximum backup limit reached.

trans-unit.source: This occurs if you exceed 255 online clones on the same device, from the same original volume which has been deleted.
trans-unit.target: This occurs if you exceed 255 online clones on the same device, from the same original volume which has been deleted.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Incorrect controller ID
trans-unit.target: Incorrect controller ID

trans-unit.source: When a controller replacement is performed, controller 0 may show up as controller 1.
trans-unit.target: When a controller replacement is performed, controller 0 may show up as controller 1.

trans-unit.source: During controller replacement, when the image is loaded from the peer node, the controller ID can show up initially as the peer controller’s ID.
trans-unit.target: During controller replacement, when the image is loaded from the peer node, the controller ID can show up initially as the peer controller’s ID.

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, this behavior may also be seen after a system reboot.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, this behavior may also be seen after a system reboot.

trans-unit.source: No user action is required.
trans-unit.target: No user action is required.

trans-unit.source: This situation will resolve itself after the controller replacement is complete.
trans-unit.target: This situation will resolve itself after the controller replacement is complete.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Device monitoring charts
trans-unit.target: Device monitoring charts

trans-unit.source: In the StorSimple Manager service, the device monitoring charts do not work when Basic or NTLM authentication is enabled in the proxy server configuration for the device.
trans-unit.target: In the StorSimple Manager service, the device monitoring charts do not work when Basic or NTLM authentication is enabled in the proxy server configuration for the device.

trans-unit.source: Modify the web proxy configuration for the device registered with your StorSimple Manager service so that authentication is set to NONE.
trans-unit.target: Modify the web proxy configuration for the device registered with your StorSimple Manager service so that authentication is set to NONE.

trans-unit.source: To do this, run the the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple Set-HcsWebProxy cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To do this, run the the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple Set-HcsWebProxy cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Storage accounts
trans-unit.target: Storage accounts

trans-unit.source: Using the Storage service to delete the storage account is an unsupported scenario.
trans-unit.target: Using the Storage service to delete the storage account is an unsupported scenario.

trans-unit.source: This will lead to a situation in which user data cannot be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: This will lead to a situation in which user data cannot be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Device failover
trans-unit.target: Device failover

trans-unit.source: Multiple failovers of a volume container from the same source device to different target devices is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Multiple failovers of a volume container from the same source device to different target devices is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Failover from a single dead device to multiple devices will make the volume containers on the first failed over device lose data ownership.
trans-unit.target: Failover from a single dead device to multiple devices will make the volume containers on the first failed over device lose data ownership.

trans-unit.source: After such a failover, these volume containers will appear or behave differently when you view them in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: After such a failover, these volume containers will appear or behave differently when you view them in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: Installation

trans-unit.source: During StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint installation, you need to provide a device IP in order for the install to finish successfully.
trans-unit.target: During StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint installation, you need to provide a device IP in order for the install to finish successfully.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Web proxy
trans-unit.target: Web proxy

trans-unit.source: If your web proxy configuration has HTTPS as the specified protocol, then your device-to-service communication will be affected and the device will go offline.
trans-unit.target: If your web proxy configuration has HTTPS as the specified protocol, then your device-to-service communication will be affected and the device will go offline.

trans-unit.source: Support packages will also be generated in the process, consuming significant resources on your device.
trans-unit.target: Support packages will also be generated in the process, consuming significant resources on your device.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the web proxy URL has HTTP as the specified protocol.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the web proxy URL has HTTP as the specified protocol.

trans-unit.source: More information on how to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: More information on how to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Web proxy
trans-unit.target: Web proxy

trans-unit.source: If you configure and enable web proxy on a registered device, then you will need to restart the active controller on your device.
trans-unit.target: If you configure and enable web proxy on a registered device, then you will need to restart the active controller on your device.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: High cloud latency and high I/O workload
trans-unit.target: High cloud latency and high I/O workload

trans-unit.source: When your StorSimple device encounters a combination of very high cloud latencies (order of seconds) and high I/O workload, the device volumes go into a degraded state and the I/Os may fail with a "device not ready" error.
trans-unit.target: When your StorSimple device encounters a combination of very high cloud latencies (order of seconds) and high I/O workload, the device volumes go into a degraded state and the I/Os may fail with a "device not ready" error.

trans-unit.source: You will need to manually reboot the device controllers or perform a device failover to recover from this situation.
trans-unit.target: You will need to manually reboot the device controllers or perform a device failover to recover from this situation.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: When these updates are applied to a physical device, the software version will change to 6.3.9600.17312.
trans-unit.target: When these updates are applied to a physical device, the software version will change to 6.3.9600.17312.

trans-unit.source: Unless otherwise specified, these release notes apply to all models of the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Unless otherwise specified, these release notes apply to all models of the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these updates, see <linkText>October 2014 physical appliance software update for Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these updates, see <linkText>October 2014 physical appliance software update for Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This release updates the driver and the firmware on the SAS controller of your physical device.
trans-unit.target: This release updates the driver and the firmware on the SAS controller of your physical device.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the SAS controller update, see <linkText>October 2014 update for LSI SAS controllers in Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the SAS controller update, see <linkText>October 2014 update for LSI SAS controllers in Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This release also applies a cumulative firmware update that addresses reliability issues with the device hardware components.
trans-unit.target: This release also applies a cumulative firmware update that addresses reliability issues with the device hardware components.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the firmware update, see <linkText>October 2014 firmware update for Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the firmware update, see <linkText>October 2014 firmware update for Microsoft Azure StorSimple Appliance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This release does not contain any updates for the virtual device.
trans-unit.target: This release does not contain any updates for the virtual device.

trans-unit.source: Applying this update will not change the software version of a virtual device.
trans-unit.target: Applying this update will not change the software version of a virtual device.
